title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jewish advocacy groups sued Medford over an ordinance mandating divestment from specific sectors for ideological reasons.
The ordinance requires divesting from companies linked to fossil fuels, defense, and alleged human rights violations, affecting city funds.
The lawsuit claims the policy violates Massachusetts laws by prioritizing ideology over financial returns and introduces political bias.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need MVP-level performance from QB Drake Maye to challenge Seattle's defense in Super Bowl LX.
New England's defense aims to pressure Seattle's QB Sam Darnold, exploiting his regular-season vulnerability under duress.
Corner Christian Gonzalez is tasked with limiting Seattle WR Jaxon Smith-Njigba's impact, focusing on 1-on-1 matchups.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 at USC and continued wearing it with the New England Patriots from 1994 to 2005.
McGinest revealed Junior Seau popularized No. 55 at USC, making it a special number for linebackers.
Junior Seau sought McGinest's approval to wear No. 55 with the Patriots, fostering a tradition of respect.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the heaviest snow, with Salisbury and Beverly both receiving 13 inches on February 7, 2026.
Bristol County saw significant snowfall with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches and Rehoboth recording 6.5 inches.
Other affected areas include Middlesex and Norfolk Counties, with Marlborough receiving 7 inches and Weymouth 5.5 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, featuring the Patriots vs. Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Tirico will work double duty, transitioning from the Super Bowl broadcast to hosting NBC's Olympic studio program.
Cris Collinsworth will join Tirico as analyst, with Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung reporting from the sidelines.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, entering as 4.5-point underdogs.
If victorious, the Patriots will achieve the greatest single-season turnaround in NFL history, moving from four to 18 wins.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, runner-up in MVP voting, could become the youngest quarterback to win a Super Bowl.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots head coach, seeks advice from Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of Super Bowl LX.
Vrabel simulates Super Bowl halftime conditions during practice, a strategy learned from Belichick and Reid.
The Patriots, led by Vrabel, achieved a 14-win season after consecutive four-win seasons, earning him Coach of the Year.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to win their seventh Super Bowl and set an NFL record for most championships by a franchise.
Quarterback Drake Maye could join elite company as the first second-year quarterback to win a Super Bowl since 2014.
Coach Mike Vrabel seeks to become the first to win a Super Bowl with the same franchise as both player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims for a Super Bowl LX win to bolster his Hall of Fame chances with the Patriots.
Diggs has four Pro Bowl selections and one first-team All-Pro, raising questions about his Hall of Fame credentials.
At 32, Diggs ranks 38th in receiving yards and 43rd in touchdowns, with potential to improve his standings.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri was pivotal in three Patriots Super Bowl wins with last-minute field goals, defining his clutch reputation.
He scored an NFL record 2,673 points across 24 seasons and made notable game-winning kicks under pressure.
